snippet: Four hundred American military personnel and two Patriot air defense batteries will be sent from the United States as cross-border tensions intensify between Turkey and Syria.
abstract: Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta signs an official deployment order to send 400 American military personnel and two Patriot air defense batteries to Turkey as its tensions intensify with neighboring Syria.

byline.original: By THOM SHANKER and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Thom Shanker reported from Incirlik Air Base, Turkey, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt from Washington; Anne Barnard, Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; Alan Cowell from London; and Ellen Barry from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Four hundred American military personnel and two Patriot air defense batteries will be sent from the United States as cross-border tensions intensify between Turkey and Syria.

headline.seo: Panetta Orders Deployment of U.S. Antimissile Units in Turkey
headline.main: Panetta Orders Deployment of U.S. Antimissile Units in Turkey
headline.print_headline: Panetta Orders Deployment of U.S. Antimissile Units in Turkey
